entry.title: On learning Ruby coming from Python ...

content.div: I am learning Ruby, and coming from Python it's not a an easy thing. Ruby is confusing, it has a weird syntax, and things are not really simple as in Python. There is still tons of stuff which seem like dark magic. There's `nil`, there are `gems` and `bundler`. And there is _Rails, which isn't Ruby_. Ruby is good for so many people out there, and I am sure you can do amazing things in it. I already know it's never going to be my weapon of choice, but it's not bad knowing my way around it. I'd like to know how to set up a simple project, read and debug code, install gems and package ruby projects. I have been ignoring Ruby for too long. continue reading...
